definition: to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
old variant of 刊[kan1]/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Public share issue is one way for the establishment of a joint stock limited haoduoren. company.
sentences.chinese: 公开刊行股票是设立股份有限公司的一种途径。

sentences.english: Further coins will be released until 2014.
sentences.chinese: 其他的硬币将在2014年刊行。

sentences.english: Financing activities relate to raising capital via issuance of capital stock or borrowing.
sentences.chinese: 融资勾当与经由过程刊行股票或借贷来增添成秘闻关。

sentences.english: With its considerably practical value, it was well respected by medical practitioners after the publishment.
sentences.chinese: 颇具实用价值，刊行后深受医者推崇。

sentences.english: Opening number refer to newspapers and periodicals begin first issue that publish formally.
sentences.chinese: 创刊号是指报刊正式开始刊行的第一期。

sentences.english: Bonds shall be accounted for at par value.
sentences.chinese: 刊行债券时，理卖按债券的面值记帐。

definition: to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to record/to put down in writing
manuscript (of a book etc)/sketch (of a design etc)
